Package net.minestom.server.chat

Class ChatColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.chat.ChatColor
  • public final class ChatColor
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a color in a text. You can either use one of the pre-made colors or make your own using RGB. fromRGB(byte, byte, byte).

    Immutable class.

    • Method Detail

      • fromRGB

        @NotNull
public static ChatColor fromRGB​(byte r,
                                byte g,
                                byte b)
        Creates an RGB color.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component
        g - the green component
        b - the blue component
        Returns:
        a chat color with the specified RGB color

      • fromName

        @NotNull
public static ChatColor fromName​(@NotNull
                                 java.lang.String name)
        Gets a color based on its name (eg: white, black, aqua, etc...).
        Parameters:
        name - the color name
        Returns:
        the color associated with the name, NO_COLOR if not found

      • fromId

        @NotNull
public static ChatColor fromId​(int id)
        Gets a color based on its numerical id (0;15).
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the color
        Returns:
        the color associated with the id, NO_COLOR if not found

      • fromLegacyColorCodes

        @NotNull
public static ChatColor fromLegacyColorCodes​(char colorCode)
        Gets a color based on its legacy color code (eg: 1, 2, 3,... f).
        Parameters:
        colorCode - the color legacy code
        Returns:
        the color associated with the code, NO_COLOR if not found

      • isSpecial

        public boolean isSpecial()
        Gets if the color is special (eg: no color, bold, reset, etc...).
        Returns:
        true if the color is special, false otherwise

      • getCodeName

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getCodeName()
        Gets the code name.
        Returns:
        the color code name, null if not any

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the color id, only present if this color has been retrieved from ChatColor constants.

        Should only be used for some special packets which require it.

        Returns:
        the color id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the color is not from the class constants

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
